column5: Has anyone dealt with Wholesale SPorts out of western canada?  They have a pretty decent sale on now.  One thing that caught my eye is the Abu MGX for $288. Its at Sail right now for $379 less 15% plus tax.  I believe there may be not sale tax applied when buying from wholesale as they don't have a presence in the democratic republic of Ontario...
Have you asked about price matching?

Watch that tax stuff - if there's hst in Sask you'll pay it - I lost that argument bringing in stuff from the east coast, prior to hst here I got it tax free - once the hst came on board in Ontario the price went up.  Michael
Bought a few things there. Good experience. Can't remember about tax.
Just deal with one of the stores in Alberta and pay GST only.
I bought a few items from them a few years back and was pleased. I think tax was a lot less but can't remember for certain.
If the taxes dont get you, then the shipping will.
The Wheel is turning and it can't slow down........  :)

guilty.  although became one later in the game. Saw Jerry when I was 13 here in Hamilton (1992).  been a big fan ever since.  I remember reading someone on this very board complaining because his wife wanted to see the Grateful Dead reunion in Chi town this summer but he wanted to go sheephead fishing instead, lol.  :)
If the taxes dont get you, then the shipping will. Free shipping on orders over $100...
Just deal with one of the stores in Alberta and pay GST only.  Thanks!  Finally a useful reply...

Just deal with one of the stores in Alberta and pay GST only.  They will direct you to order from their website, and you will be billed your home tax rate when you enter your address  I shop a lot of WSS, in store they are like any other big box store...online is generally good, but have had some slow processing frustration before, and their online inventory is not always accurate
There's a customer service number on the site. Why not just call them and ask?

WSS opened a new store in South Edmonton that is really set up nice, almost like a Cabela's. It wouldn't hurt to call one of the larger stores and ask them. Everyone's hurting in Alberta right now and they'd be a fool not to sell to you.
Well did ya pull the trigger and what was the total bill?
